intro: Leucanthemum ircutianum var. laticeps, commonly known as the shrub leucanthemum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Europe and parts of western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a bushy growth habit with multiple stems. The plant produces large, showy white to pale yellow flowers with a central brown disc, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are broadly ovate, with a rough texture and serrated edges, often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, loamy soils.
